commit.message:
Windows 3.8 asyncio fix

Upstream tornado devs are not going to configure the async event
loop due to it causing performance issues on other systems.
Instead they suggest using this workaround.

https://github.com/tornadoweb/tornado/issues/2608

This patch adds the ability to add or override HTTP headers.

* Allow zero delay to open web browser

verification.payload:
tree 7e516680e9dae30da43977b75efc99daade4eba4
parent db0c52d519f3a67bef19a1905a1cca5c7523e27d

commit.message: Pass the list of changed files to the _func_ callback if it supports arguments

Support ** recursive globs by default - close #156

Sadly, currently `**` glob patterns are just ignored.
It discovered this due to its usage une the recently introduced [pelican invoke task dedicated to livereload](https://github.com/getpelican/pelican/blob/master/pelican/tools/templates/tasks.py.jinja2#L103)

This has already been suggested as a custom watcher in #156.

However, as [Python 2 end of life is scheduled in less than 6 months](https://pythonclock.org),
I think we could rely on `glob.glob` `recursive` optional argument to be supported fairly often.
Still, this PR is fully backward-compatible as it checks for a Python minimum version of 3.5

verification.payload:
tree e0e62cadf166df34412b026f40896425ce6b4e7a
parent db0c52d519f3a67bef19a1905a1cca5c7523e27d
author Lucas Cimon <lucas.cimon@gmail.com> 1563902449 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1563902449 +0200

Support ** recursive globs by default - close #156

Sadly, currently `**` glob patterns are just ignored.
It discovered this due to its usage une the recently introduced [pelican invoke task dedicated to livereload](https://github.com/getpelican/pelican/blob/master/pelican/tools/templates/tasks.py.jinja2#L103)

This has already been suggested as a custom watcher in #156.

However, as [Python 2 end of life is scheduled in less than 6 months](https://pythonclock.org),
I think we could rely on `glob.glob` `recursive` optional argument to be supported fairly often.
Still, this PR is fully backward-compatible as it checks for a Python minimum version of 3.5
